rounds.category: WHAT IS THIS, SOME KIND OF JOKE?

clues.text:
From this sitcom:
"How's life treating you, Norm?"
"Like it caught me in bed with his wife"

From this '70s radio station sitcom:
"As god is my witness, I thought turkeys could fly"

Shatner, on this show:
"dennycranelaw.com. Pictures, bios, hobbies. I once captained my own spaceship. Multi-talented"

Chandler, to Ross on this show:
"3 failed marriages, 2 illegitimate children... the personal ad writes itself"

Steven Culp on this show (after being called Dr. Van de Kamp):
"Please, you're dating my wife. Call me Rex"
Barry Goldwater, in Arizona, which still had this status
U Thant, in this current country
This "Streetcar Named Desire" director, in Constantinople
This film critic & "A Death in the Family" novelist
Andrei Gromyko, the face of the USSR as this minister from 1957 to 1985
It's what the tail does if things are backwards
Who can forget Mena Suvari on a bed of petals in this film? (The title is a type of rose)
Americans say "the whole enchilada"; Brits say this, a Best Picture Oscar nominee from 1997
This 1996 Geena Davis action title can be a euphemism for death (Hint: In the film, she puts her past life to bed)
Of the 10 targets one bowls at, it's designated No. 5; it also can refer to a person of chief importance
The first known design of a self-propelled vehicle was made by this artist & scientist around 1478
Some scientists predict this "seasonal" period of cold & dark weather would be the result of atomic warfare
Astronomer Michael Brown discovered the object classified as UB313 in 2003 & named it for this TV princess
These radiation belts named for an American physicist are found in the earth's magnetosphere
Darwin's younger contemporary, this 3-named scientist evolved a similar 1850s theory of natural selection
Pairs of these slightly dished metal circular plates have clashed together since Assyrian times
There's a Great Highland type of this musical instrument
In "The Music Man", "Seventy-six trombones led the big parade with a hundred and ten" of these "close at hand"
As a verb, this musical instrument means "to dwell upon persistently & tediously"
Comrade, enjoy this 3-stringed Russian instrument with a triangular body & a thin neck
A standard or pennant
Temperance leader Carry
Permission granted to a sailor to go ashore
Declares
The meaning of the Greek word "atomos" which gives us "atom"
Secretary of State Rusk visited this capital to assure South Vietnam we wouldn't sell it out
On Dec. 18 this Dr. Seuss animated classic aired for the first time
This leader launched his Cultural Revolution
U.S. Catholic bishops did away with the rule prohibiting this on Fridays
The Tashkent agreement, signed in the USSR, ended a 17-day war between these 2 other countries of Asia
"Who Censored Roger Rabbit?"
"Vengeance: The True Story of an Israeli Counter-Terrorist Team"
"Wiseguy"
"The Murder of Bob Crane"

A 2008 award-winning movie:
"Q & A"
It comes between Doctors & Borders in an international humanitarian organization
If this preposition didn't exist, we'd have song titles like "More Than There" & "More Than The Rainbow"
It's the 4-letter preposition in the 4-word phrase that starts many a fairy tale
It precedes "wraps" when keeping something a secret
To infinity & this preposition, as they say in "Toy Story"
A symbol of Judaism, the star of David is formed by 2 interlocking these
In March 2007 Colorado adopted as its second state song this John Denver hit
The cooling capacity of an air conditioner is measured in these 3-letter units
This attraction at Disneyland is about 1/100th the height of its real Swiss counterpart
This bay on the U.S. Atlantic Coast is actually the submerged valley of the Susquehanna River
The 3 Baltic states are Estonia, Latvia & this other country
Linus Pauling had the same initials as this other chemist who lived in France 100 years earlier
The 2 official languages of Haiti are Creole & this
Among the 30 busiest airports in the U.S. are O'Hare & this other one in Chicago
The holiest cities in Islam are Mecca & this
On June 15, 1991 a volcanic eruption tore the top off Mount Pinatubo in this country
Mount Ansel Adams is found on the southeast boundary of this national park
When Mount Everest's summit was reached in May 1953, this became the world's highest unclimbed peak
Of South America's 10 highest peaks, 9 of them rise all or in part in this country
This highest Australian peak was named for a Polish patriot who aided America during the Revolutionary War

rounds.text: He rhymed the title character of one of his best-known poems with "drew on", "threw on" & "ruin"
